figure_1.title: Figure 1.
figure_1.caption:
Framework showing the dynamic relationships involved in loneliness and social isolation
(Adapted from National Academies of Science, Engineering and Medicine, 2020)

figure_2.title: Figure 2.
figure_2.caption: Excerpt of questions from interviews with Individuals with SCI/D

claims.sentence: An adapted version of the National Academies of Science, Engineering and Medicine (NASEM, 2020) guiding framework of loneliness and social isolation is depicted in Figure 1.

Deidentified data will be made available upon reasonable request to the primary author (study PI) pending approval of the organization’s institutional review board.Design and Framework
We implemented a descriptive qualitative design using in-depth semi-structured interviews to answer the research question: What do individuals with SCI/D identify as facilitators to alleviate loneliness and social isolation? To guide this work, we used an adapted version of the loneliness and social isolation framework (Figure 1) (NASEM, 2020).
Interview questions are shown in in Figure 2.

The thematic analysis approach supported a focus on the data, while recognizing pragmatic limitations, and provided adequate flexibility to permit an understanding of how individuals make meaning of experiences (Braun & Clarke, 2006) within the framework of loneliness and social isolation (Figure 1) (NASEM, 2020).
An adapted version of the National Academies of Science, Engineering and Medicine (NASEM, 2020) guiding framework of loneliness and social isolation is depicted in Figure 1.
